Yesterday we worked on developing our community survey for Awareness and Attitudes of Suicide among Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people n communities on the Sunshine Coast #TheAlliance #FirstNationsStrategy #SunshineCoast  #developingthebaselinelocally https://t.co/wvWoxHeP6v

Another SafeTALK done .. another 32 people in community trained n now suicide alert helpers. Interesting questions thrown at me today n a few at the end come up 2 ask me about the First Nations strategy n action plan. Good feedback, lookin forward to safeYARN #watchthisspace

When you factor in all mental illness prevalence in 12 mths, it‚Äôs 1 in 1600. Lifetime prevalence shows 45 in every 100 adults experience a clinical #mentalhealth condition. That alone is not the critical factor in #suicide. https://t.co/KJzCoXNP6J

Of course it doesn‚Äôt stack up. Over a million Australians experience depression every year. Over 2 million other mood disorders yet less than 1 in 1000 die by #suicide. It is a common risk factor but it is life events that largely cascade a person to #suicide. https://t.co/2GS9MbRcus

Exactly right. We‚Äôll never have enough imminent risk services or post attempt services - already approx 90,000 ppl attempt #suicide every year. They sometimes need years of support. We must slow the flow by moving efforts upstream. @Bowenchris @ian_hickie https://t.co/0fmn3Hl2pN

Google public health upstream. It means addressing social determinants or context & not focussing all efforts on people already downstream & ill/injured or at imminent risk. We R only adding to the weight of social determinants on #mentalillness & #suicide in Aust. Same in US. https://t.co/yVNLyuk5fN
Suicide is not a joke.

There‚Äôs a creeping effort to censor public discourse on #suicide. Be it in performing arts or in the community‚Äôs right to know. Best way to make a social problem worse, bury facts & don‚Äôt talk about it. @CMorgan265 @BrogdenLucy @ian_hickie @GerryGeorgatos @adelec23 @SabraLane https://t.co/z7OUhpb6tP

The lack of timely public reporting of suicide & self harm data disempowers & alienates communities. Every successful public health program relies on solid, accessible epidemiology. Time for change. @PatMcGorry @ian_hickie @BrogdenLucy @FeneleyJohn @GerryGeorgatos @adelec23 https://t.co/z7OUhpb6tP

Thanks Marc. The other important factor in the AIHW data on vets, is that it‚Äôs only within a decade of discharge. Jeff died 12 yrs after leaving the Navy. His 1st suicide attempt was 1 month post discharge. So the data is ‚Äòlimited‚Äô. https://t.co/3YbBPpwf1O

For the record veterans discharged before age 24 have at least twice the rate of suicide as the non vet same age peers & those under 30, 160% higher rate. I don‚Äôt consider that low. My nephew one of them. https://t.co/g0LJxpEYyu

2/3 #Mentalillness is a factor in a majority of #suicide in Australia BUT for every 50 adults who experience a MI only 1 will attempt or die by suicide. So why a Roundtable with only reps of #Mentalhealth orgs? @SabraLane @MichaelMarmot @Bowenchris https://t.co/QrWIMwSCem

1/3 There are several striking points from this photo of the hour-long Roundtable on #SuicidePrevention. 1. Clearly, Minister Cs the solution to the nation‚Äôs #suicide crisis as a matter of more awareness, more & better clinical services. @SabraLane @MichaelMarmot @Bowenchris https://t.co/QrWIMwSCem

We have to get the balance right. The decline of the #mentalhealth & the #suicide crisis around the nation parallels the decline & losses of environment & species. We can & must do better. @ian_hickie @PatMcGorry @Bowenchris @sussanley @AnnastaciaMP https://t.co/zZKT2Jhr8k

Did the Roundtable address why 60% of #suicide deaths come from the 2 lowest quintiles of social & economic index? Was the gross inequities in the #BetterAccess program addressed? Or was it more about > awareness? @GregHuntMP @Bowenchris @SabraLane @leighsales https://t.co/Alx1TQ24MJ

It‚Äôs not just youth suicide. Highest numbers are 30-44 yrs. we must have a plan to address the drivers of despair if we are to see any significant & sustained reduction. @GerryGeorgatos @ian_hickie @croakeyblog https://t.co/uRnmQKWmJ6

So the nation has decided that inequality is more important than inclusion, that rising #suicide rates don‚Äôt matter, that criminal behaviour doesn‚Äôt matter. Australia will be the poorer for this. Much poorer. #AusVotes2019

#TheDrum Australia is now 1 of the most unequal societies in the world. The more unequal a society the higher #homelessness, #domesticviolence, #childdetention, #mentalillness, #suicide & more. @ellenmfanning @ABCthedrum

Greater poverty in Australia is fueling more child abuse & trauma & ultimately more #mentalillness #selfharm & #suicide. #AUSVote2019 is an opportunity to turn this around & tackling inequality @MichaelMarmot @SabraLane @PatsKarvelas
